task.title: How To Connect Devices?
task.shortdesc: This topic explains how to connect smart devices to a Wi-Fi network using standard setup procedures, and includes important compatibility tips and a reference to troubleshooting resources.

ul.li: The Wi-Fi SSID (network name) and password are available.
Your mobile device has the necessary manufacturer app installed.
The device is powered on and in pairing mode.

step.cmd: Open the device manufacturer's app on your smartphone or tablet.
Navigate to the “Add Device” or “Connect” option.
Select your device model from the list.
When prompted, enter the Wi-Fi SSID and password.
Confirm the connection and wait for the device to link to the network.
Check the app for a success confirmation or status update.
Optionally, rename the device and assign it to a room or category for easier management.

postreq.note: Many smart devices only support 2.4GHz Wi-Fi bands. If your router is set to 5GHz only or using band steering, connection attempts may fail. Check your router settings and connect to a 2.4GHz network if needed.
postreq.p: If you experience connectivity issues, refer to the topic Troubleshoot Connectivity Problems.
